intro: Adenolinum angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenolinum, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and has a low, spreading habit. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Adenolinum angustifolium produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, often blooming in spring.
